answers.answer: Aspirin is a common preventative for alot of things in pregnancy. I'm on it to help prevent placental abruption (have a history)
Interesting.  I'm a little reluctant because the medicine itself is FDA pregnancy category D but I'm sure the doctors know what they are doing.
Just checked and appears safe during the 2nd and 3rd trimester.

Yeah not in the first. I couldn't start until 12 weeks and even that was too soon for some drs. It's 100mg, to put that in prospective when you take aspirin for a headache you take 600mg. So its a crazy low dose that has no problem in your system
Thanks for sharing your experience.  Makes me feel better.

question: I've been placed on daily baby aspirin to prevent preeclampsia.  Has this happened to any of you?
title: low dose aspirin
